newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - August 4.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - August 4.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Monday:

* On Friday, the Dow Jones industrial average fell 28.57 points to 8,194.04 as investors, lulled by recent signs of mild inflation, were shocked by surprisingly strong reports on U.S. employment and manufacturing activity.

* At least nine firms are expected to offer shares to the public in the second half of this year. The firms are likely to raise a total of some two trillion rupiah, Bisnis Indonesia newspaper reported.
* On Friday, the Jakarta composite index was up 0.50 points, or 0.07 percent, at the close at 721.77 points.
* On Monday, the rupiah was traded at 2,600.00/04.00 at 0250 GMT against an opening of 2,590.00/95.00.
* Semen Gresik after announcement of poor first half net profits.
* Bank Ficorinvest on an announcement Bhakti Investama planned to raise its stake in the bank to 26.0 percent from 19.41 percent.
* Toll road operator Citra Marga on market talk it was likely to take over the operation of some lucrative toll roads from the state-owned firm Jasa Marga.
* Property firm Elang Realty on announcement of a rights issue.
* Mining firm Inco after announcement of poor first half net profits.
